result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Scott Zuber

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
4:01 PM 2:49 PM Defendant Randall Scott Zuber not in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Randall Scott Zuber.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of DA Craig Nolen. Defendant is currently at an in patient facility. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing by Attorney Witt.  Attorney Witt requests this to be set out 60 days. No objection by the State. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: GCCOCC emailed to Green County Sheriff Dept - SIBS & NOH

Violation - Bail Jumping-Felony.  Issuing Agency - GCSD.
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.

1:28 PM Defendant Randall Scott Zuber appeared by video, in custody with Atty Ryan Ohara by video.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.   Bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm. ADA Lantta to cover.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
